captions.text:
Hang up your jacket on these Atari coat hooks
and then put on some Yoshi's Egg Nipple Tassels...?
I'm Jake and this is episode #6 of Game LUT.

Get your friends together and play a game
of Fallout Monopoly with this custom-made

set. Then, impress, and slightly scare, them
with an Xbox controller that has bullet shells
for buttons.

But, if you'd rather be alone, put on these
painted Zelda headphones and listen to the

sweet jams of Link Floyd. Then, hop on your
PC and download the free game Street Fighter

X Megaman. The game was made to celebrate
the 25th anniversary of both franchises, and

it replaces the bosses from Megaman with Street
Fighter characters.

Since you're already on a computer, you might
as well download the My Little Ponies Skyrim
mod...soooo...yeah...

But lets get out of here, so put on your Assassin's
Creed dog-tag necklace, your Creeper sunglasses,
and check yourself out in these Portal Mirrors.

Then, check out these incredible papercrafts
made by artist Will Pigg.

Now let's-
"Peeeka "

Now let's-
"Peeeeka"

Pikachu, no!
"Peeeeeka"

Pikachu, no!
"Peeeeeeeka"

Pikachu go home
"Peeeeeeeeeeka"
Pikachu go home you're drunk!...cake

After defeating a pokémon in a battle of
sobriety, give yourself these awesome Gym

Badges to let the ladies know that you're
not only brave, but handsome...Jack mask.

You can try and build your own, or buy one
and paint it yourself.

Once you've wooed that special someone, give
them an 8bit heart ring that you put inside

your Will You Be My Player 2 engagement-ring
box. I think I hear a baby on the way, so

stuff that tiny person in a Master Chief onesie,
then get that baby a Super Meat Boy saw blade

pillow- and, since you have a family to support
now, grab your briefcase made out of a Nintendo
console and finish your Miner Studies.

But, if you're forever alone, you can always
stare at your Princess Peach Pin-up and play

with your GameStick- an incredibly small,
and portable, game system.

The Game Stick is as big as a thumbdrive and
tiny enough to fit in its own controller.

It plugs directly into your TV via hdmi, and
has full access to the Android market. This

tiny little thing is packed with a 1.5ghz
dual core processor, 1gig of ram, and built

in WiFi . The whole package only costs $79,
and you can back the GameStick right now on
Kickstarter.

If you want to stay small then create this
DIY arcade by Sprites Mods that may be the
smallest arcade cabinet in the world.

Become an Expert Killer Whale, pop a Fallout
Mentat in your mouth, and subscribe to Vsauce3
for more Game LUT.

Links to everything can be found in the description
below.
I'm Jake and, as always, thanks for watching.
